skillTree.localised_description: When Ur-Khan escaped the pits of Ghrond, he did so upon the back of a mighty dark pegasus, soaring through the red lightning of the Raging Sky.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: The Hung are nomads who ride tough steeds bred for endurance and survival in the harsh climes of their hunting grounds. These people live in the saddle—some say they are even born there.
The tribes hold no compunction about merging with others to form alliances  one moment, or breaking pacts in the next. Likewise, tribesmen will be quick to abandon a cowardly khan.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
Sold into slavery by his uncle, Ur-Khan’s youth was spent struggling for survival in the mines and fighting pits of Ghrond. There, he fostered a grim resolve and pledged revenge.
Although now free, Ur-Khan's burns with a simmering lust for retribution.
The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: After twenty long years of hardship, Ur-Khan escaped from Ghrond upon the back of his dark pegasus. It was then, soaring through a mighty storm, that he made a dark vow and began his journey as Herald of the Raging Sky.
"His words are blessed by the Great Serpent, warm as airag and as entrancing as as a steppe spirit."

effects.description:
Enables charmed attacks for Nomad units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Where he goes, the ground rots and blooms anew, for the Great Vulture watches his path."

effects.description:
Immune to disease and plague attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "His mind is keen as a blade and quick as the falcon, for he has been taught by the Great Eagle."

effects.description:
Miscast base chance: +30%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: "Mighty is his sword, for with it he makes countless offerings to the Great Wolf and leaves a river of blood."

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: Ur-Khan continues to fulfill his storm-vow, and has been blessed with great power in return. Now, man becomes a temporary vessel for the energies of the Four, a demi-godlike conduit for the Raging Sky.

effects.description: Enables transformation: "Harbinger of the Raging Sky"

ui_effects.localised_text: Becomes the daemonic Harbinger of the Raging Sky
Transformation causes health loss over time when enemies are not present nearby
Exchanges his prowess as a duelist with a array of potent army-wide support skills

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

effects.description:
Several of Ur-Khan's abilities will be replaced
	(while Harbinger form is active)
Diplomatic relations: +25 with Warriors of Chaos, Norsca, Daemons of Chaos, and Hung factions

skillTree.localised_description: Ur-Khan’s life has been a constant struggle for survival. There are valuable lessons to be learned by those who can endure such trials, however.
The mines below Ghrond were no place for a child to grow up, and so Ur-Khan has learned how bear pain even under a torrent of blows.
Through years in the gladiatorial pits of Ghrond, Ur-Khan has learned to bide his time and wait for his enemy to tire or their attention to slip.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Ur-Khan has learned to never hesitate when the opportunity for a decisive blow comes, and his blurring violence earned him the moniker ‘The Swift Fury.’
Ur-Khan has grown into a fearsome fighter, his body and senses sharpened by the constant hardships he’s endured over the years.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Crafted of many small plates of iron, steel, or leather laced together, this tough armour is both strong and flexible.
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These wandering hunters care only for three things: killing, plundering, and their horses.

skillTree.localised_description: To these, there is no greater pleasure than to fight by the light of a burning town, no finer music than the terrified screams of the innocent and the cowardly.

skillTree.localised_description: To survive on the Eastern Steppes, a tribesman needs a horse and bow. Without these, there is nothing but starvation or death.

skillTree.localised_description: The ground shakes, stones dance, and dust rises on the horizon. The savage horde comes.

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows to bring plenty of meat when going to war, for the great centigor herds are ravenous and only momentarily appeased.

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the steppes are both a danger and an asset. This warlord knows how to turn them against the horde’s foes.

skillTree.localised_description: “Blow the horns! Raise the horsehair banner! We strike their army’s flank!”
Scarred and mutilated, their “beautiful” visages inspire fear among their foes.

skillTree.localised_description: Layers of horn, wood, and monstrous sinew give these compact just as much power as the finest longbow.

skillTree.localised_description: Despite being part of a treacherous and rowdy people, these warriors are a different sort, tempered by battle and fiercely loyal.

skillTree.localised_description: These creatures are mythical inhabitants of the north and east, sacred heralds of the Ruinous Powers.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Despite being called a primitive hunter-gatherer by settled races, this warlord is an expert at maneuvering forces across a battlefield.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
Each member of the tribe carries on their stout steed a filthy woolen tent and everything they need to get by.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
"This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: “The time has come! Gather the tribes and limber your bows; we ride to raze the settled lands!”
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The rise to power is dangerous and never secure, for all Hung are ambitious and willing to kill to get what they want.

The steppes are battered by fierce storms and lack in food, but the Hung endure. When hunting is scarce they’ll eat almost anything, and when riding across great distances they’ll drink the blood from their living steeds.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Roaming across the easternmost lands of the Eastern Steppes, the Mung often find themselves in conflict with the folk of Naggaroth. Their tribe, named for their Munggat leaders, field renowned cavalry said to be blessed by the Ruinous Powers.

effects.description: Fearful Subjects: Tribute from vassals: +10% for each active war
Landlocked Tribesmen: Leadership, Melee Attack, and Melee Defense -8 when fighting at sea
Harbinger of the Raging Sky: Chosen by the Ruinous Powers as their herald, Ur-Khan rides forth, razing cities and expanding the Endless Steppe across all the world.

Melee attack: +4 when fighting against Dark Elves
	(all armies)
Double experience gain for units when fighting against Dark Elves

items.colour_text: Even peeled and boiled of flesh, the skull is as hideous as its former owner, and a grim promise to any who would think to betray Ur-Khan.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

items.colour_text: Made of layered bands of flexible leather and ensorcelled by the Mung's shaman, this armour emits a cold mist which only touches the wearer's foes.
Passed down from father to daughter to son, this saber has been carried by the heirs of the Munggat bloodline for centuries. Despite its age and constant use, it is still keen and unbent.
"And so he came, riding on a black steed, and with him came the world's destruction."

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with Warriors of Chaos, Norsca, Daemons of Chaos, and Hung factions

item_set.description: Ur-Khan and Shuurghan ride through lightning and gale without fear, for the Raging Sky protects them.

Transformation causes health loss over time when enemies are not present nearby
Exchanges his prowess as a duelist with a array of potent army-wide support skills

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

ui_effects.localised_text: Redirects projectiles back towards the firing unit

phases.onscreen_name: Projectiles fired by the unit are reflected back at it!

backgroundSkills.localised_description: During his years of enslavement, Ur-Khan kept tight control of his simmering anger, using it to give him the strength and speed to endure the years of torment and danger.

Passive ability: "Rage" for Hung cavalry
	(Lord's army)
